questions.text: In a results of semen analysis of a young male have been given. 5 million/ml concentration, 50% motility, 4% normal morphology. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Oligospermia 

The given scenario of decreased sperm concentration with normal range of motility and morphology points to the diagnosis of oligospermia.  Oligospermia is defined as sperm concentration of <15 million/ml. It is further subdivided into mild-moderate oligospermia when the concentration is 10-15 million sperms /ml & severe oligospermia when the concentration is <5 million sperms/ml.

questions.text: A 20 year old girl presents with primary amenorrhea. On examination breasts were found to be poorly developed, vagina was present. Ultrasound revealed normal uterus but gonads weren't detected. Further evaluation done showed 46XY karyotype. The most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D) 

Swyer's syndrome 

The given clinical scenario of a 46 XY individual with female internal & external genitalia and poorly developed breasts, presenting with primary amenorrhea points towards the diagnosis of sweyer’s syndrome.

questions.text: The most important marker of male fertility in semen analysis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Morphology

Morphology of sperms is the most important marker of male fertility. While sperm concentration and progressive motility have value for distinguishing infertile men, strict sperm morphology is the most important discriminating value compared toother parameters

questions.text: At term pregnancy, the normal amniotic fluid appearance is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D) 

Cloudy with white specks 

At term, the amniotic fluid is cloudy and contains a large number of white flakes of vernix. Amniotic fluid appearance is determined by the proportion of cloudiness and the number of flakes released from the fetal skin over the period of pregnancy. This is summated by the amniotic fluid macroscore.

choices.text: Manual support to perineum to maintain flexion of head
Never give warm compress to the perineum

questions.text: Which of the following is part of the WHO guidelines for the management of second stage of labor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Manual support to perineum to maintain flexion of head 

The practice of guarding the perineum during delivery of the fetal head is part of the WHO management guidelines for the second stage of labor. The fingers of one hand support the perineum, while the second hand applies pressure to the fetal head to control the speed of crowning. The advantage of this is to prevent perineal tears.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman underwent a workup for primary infertility. On hysterosalpingography, there was a bilateral cornual block. What is the next step in management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Hysteroscopy and laparoscopy-guided surgery 

In the given clinical scenario, the next step in management will be hysteroscopy and laparoscopy-guided surgery. Tubal contractions, particularly cornual spasms, can give an incorrect impression of proximal fallopian tube obstruction (a false-positive result) on hysterosalpingography. Laparoscopy with chromotubation is therefore considered to confirm the diagnosis of cornual spasm. Laparoscopy is both diagnostic and therapeutic in this condition.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman comes with a history of postcoital bleeding and a visible mass seen in the cervix per speculum. The next step to be done:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C) 

Targeted biopsy 

A targeted biopsy is the next line of management in the patient with a visible cervical mass and postcoital bleeding. A pap smear is done when there are symptoms with no identifiable lesion.

questions.text: For emergency contraception, a single tab of 0.75 mg of LNG was taken, it should be followed by which of the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Single dose of 0.75 after 12 hrs 

In this case, the 2nd dose of LNG 0.75 mg (levonorgestrel) is taken after 12 hours.  Levonorgestrel (LNG) is an effective and safe option for emergency contraception. A 0.75 mg tablet should be taken within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse, followed by a second 0.75 mg tablet 12 hours later. Alternatively, a single 1.5 mg dose can be taken.

questions.text: A primigravida came to the labor room at 40 weeks + 5 days gestation for induction of labor. On per vaginal examination, the cervix is 1 cm dilated and is 30?faced. The vertex is at -1 station and the cervix is soft and posterior. What will be the bishop score for this lady?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

5

Cervical dilatation is 1 cm, hence score = 1.

Effacement is 30%, hence score = 0

Station of the head is -1, hence score = 2

Consistency of cervix is soft, hence score = 2

Position of the cervix is posterior, hence score = 0

Hence, Bishop's score is 1+0+2+2+0 = 5.

questions.text: A primigravida came with 6 cm cervical dilatation and a contraction rate of 3/10 minutes. Which stage of labor is she in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

1st stage 

In this case, cervical dilatation of 6 cm and contraction rate of 3/10 minutes is indicative of first stage of labor. The first stage of labor is characterized by dilatation and effacement of cervix and can be divided into latent phase and active labor.

questions.text: A 53-year-old postmenopausal woman is found to have endometrial hyperplasia with atypia. What is the next step in management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Hysterectomy 

Among the given options, for post-menopausal women with atypical endometrial hyperplasia, the next step in management would be a hysterectomy because the risk of progression to cancer over time approximates 29 per cent. Due to a high rate of finding concurrent invasive malignancy coexistent with atypical hyperplasia, the ideal management is to perform a fractional curettage with hysteroscopy before proceeding with a hysterectomy (with removal of both tubes and ovaries).

questions.text: A 16-year-old female patient presents with an ovarian mass. On further evaluation, her serum biomarkers are found to be normal except for LDH, which ts found to be elevated. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Dysgerminoma 

The given clinical history of a 16-year-old female presenting with an ovarian mass and raised LDH, points towards the diagnosis of dysgerminoma.

choices.text: Low MSAFP, high hCG, low UE3
High MSAFP, low hCG, high UE3
Low MSAFP, high hCG, high UE3
High MSAFP, low hCG, low UE3

questions.text: A pregnant woman has a fetus with Down's syndrome. Triple test done at 15-16 weeks will have:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Low MSAFP, high hCG, low UE3

The triple test findings in pregnancies with fetal Down's syndrome are characterized by: 
Low MSAFP (maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein) levels, approximately 0.7 MoM (multiples of median). 
Low unconjugated estriol levels, approximately 0.8 MoM. 
High hCG levels, approximately 2.0 MoM. 
The triple test is done between 15-18 weeks for the diagnosis of Down's syndrome.

questions.text: In a partogram, where do you start plotting with 1st contractions?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C) 

Before the alert line 

In a partograph, labor is graphed and analysis includes use of action lines and alert lines. A partograph was designed by WHO for use in developing countries. Partograph is similar for nulliparas and multiparas. Active phase starts at 3cm cervical dilatation and progress should be no slower than 1cm/hour

questions.text: A pregnant lady of 49 kg is in her first trimester. What are her additional calorie requirements in this trimester?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C) 

Continue same diet

The first trimester does not require additional calories beyond the usual diet for most pregnant individuals.
Although pregnancy overall increases energy needs—roughly 80,000 kcal over the course of gestation—this excess is largely accumulated during the last 20 weeks. To accommodate this demand, a modest daily energy boost of 100–300 kcal is often recommended during pregnancy. Importantly, this extra energy should not be distributed evenly across all trimesters.
The Institute of Medicine (2006) suggests adding the following amounts to the estimated nonpregnant energy requirements:
- 0 kcal/day in the first trimester
- 340 kcal/day in the second trimester
- 452 kcal/day in the third trimester
In summary, energy needs rise progressively across pregnancy, with small incremental increases in the second and especially the third trimester

questions.text: A 18 year old girl with primary amenorrhea, no breast development and Prader 3 genitalia was found to have raised FSH. Her karyotype revealed 45 XO/46 XY and USG revealed Mullerian structures with poorly visualized gonads. What would be the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Bilateral gonadectomy

In Turner's syndrome, most affected individuals have a 45,X karyotype, while others have mosaic karyotypes (45,X/46,XX; 45,X/46,XY).The presence of Y chromosome material is associated with a 12% risk of a gonadoblastoma. If a Y chromosome is identified, laparoscopic prophylactic gonadectomy is recommended at the time of diagnosis to eliminate the risk of malignancy.

questions.text: The deepest part of perineal body injury, which causes cystocoele, enterocoele and urethral descent is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Pubococcygeous 

Pubococcygeus is the deepest part of the levator ani muscle. Injury to it can cause enterocele, cystocele, and urethral descent. Levator ani muscles are the most important muscles in the pelvic floor and maintain a constant state of contraction. They provide a stable floor and support the weight of the abdominopelvic contents against intra-abdominal forces. Weakening of levator ani and pelvic fascia from stretching or tearing during childbirth, may decrease support for the vagina, bladder, uterus, or rectum or alter the position of the neck of the bladder and urethra

choices.text: Systemic hypertension within 10 weeks of gestation

questions.text: Which is not seen in pregnancy induced hypertension?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Systemic hypertension within 10 weeks of gestation 

Hypertension induced by pregnancy is gestational hypertension which is characterized by BP more than 140/90 mmHg after 20 weeks of gestation in a previously normotensive woman

questions.text: HPV nonavalent vaccine is active against which of the following serotypes?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D) 

6,11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, 58 

HPV nonavalent vaccine (Gardasil 9 or HPV9) is active against HPV 6,11,16,18,31,33,45,52,58. Currently, HPV nonnavalent vaccine has replaced Gardasil which is a quadrivalent vaccine acting against 6,11,16,18

choices.text: No need additional dose since she is ICT negative
Give another dose of Anti D 72 hour postpartum irrespective of baby blood group
Give another dose of Anti D 72 hour  postpartum depending on the baby blood group

questions.text: Rh negative mother, ICT negative was given Anti D during 28 week of pregnancy. Which of the following is the ideal one?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C) 

Give another dose of Anti D 72 hour  postpartum depending on the baby blood group 

Anti-D should be given postnatally within 72 hours & all women who deliver Rh D-positive baby should have quantification of fetomaternal hemorrhage to guide appropriate dose of anti D prophylaxis.
